bow: dadditor needs help from mommitors post pregnancy change in wife removed sounds like she dealing with serious post partin depression or anxiety not really sure how you should go about getting her help but it clear she needs some asap dont wait for pop psych diagnoses and prognoses here get professional help pronto this is not going to get better by itself and likely will get dangerous physically as well as psychologically she needs help not normal postpartum depression can often manifest as anger it definitely did for me and depending on how well your lo sleeps the sleep deprivation on top of it does not help she may not take it well but think you need to gently as possible and not at time when you are fighting suggest she go see trusted doctor and have things checked out she will probably not like it but it may also help to have her mother or friend suggest it as well few notes for context baby is exclusively breastfed she does take bottles otherwise have been helping with feeding long ago my wife feeds her on demand which support her leaving our baby with me so she can have her own time is frankly impossible yes know how terrible that is her baby waking up in the middle of the night routine involves her getting her out of the bassinet taking her to the nursery to change her diaper going to the living room to feed her burping her and giving her time upright to prevent spitting up and to fall asleep it routine she developed and wants to keep in place every single time woke up when she was getting our baby out and asked if she wanted my help she gave me very clear no with her head she didn want any interruptions in the routine we agreed that if she *does* need my help that she is to wake me up and ll take over this has happened once maybe twice in the past couple of months she is stay at home mom am at work at full time job she has her own personal business that she manages in her own time obviously that very relative term and absolutely recognize that she does what she can with our baby as far as activities outside the house are concerned but anything she does must involve our daughter so she doing kid things and not adult things to reiterate leaving our baby with me isn an option since she is exclusively breastfed we have no friends or family here to help us it us and that it this also excludes daycare which we can afford here anyway when she is being overwhelmed with whatever makes her behave this way she is terribly good person she great mother who loves our daughter and is always looking for thing to help enrich her development her real self is nothing like the person am living with now but *this* person believes that she *is* the real version of her and that her awful thoughts and feelings are genuine do believe it we have our differences and things have always been peachy keen but that nothing really extraordinary we used to hold hands kiss call each other by pet names laugh and smile together from the very day we got home from the hospital that all virtually completely disappeared to be fair know and am well aware that you re only getting my side of this surely if she were to tell her perspective it would sound much different would like to get some insight into this know not the only man who has experienced this kind of change in behavior wrote nearly identical post in daddit and someone pmed me with story so close to mine it was uncanny had told the details posted here which made it more unreal is this ppd is it just the hormonal imbalance that still working itself out both neither know you ca get inside her head but this is my experience and relaying it the best can trying to be as objective as possible hate to say this but know she wo be receptive at all if her mother suggests it or anyone else for that matter it would scream that told them what was going on which she would interpret it as me just talking bad about her behind her back she wo admit that she is wrong in any of this so getting her to admit that she needs help is believe virtually impossible know what you mean but not really looking for any kind of fake clinical diagnosis want to know what women who have been through an experience like this on my wife side that is have to say about how they felt what made them feel better what it took for it to go away how long it took to go away etc relegated to handling this on my own admitting she needs help is an insult to the ego of this version of her that would mean she was wrong and that her horrible behavior is was unjustified and that flat out unacceptable to this version of her overnight diaper changes should be necessary for month old unless baby has pooped or has rash that combined with leaving the room with baby will wake baby up further and make overnight waking habit instead of needing something issue and if baby wakes out of habit it harder to get baby to stop that that aside it sounds like your wife has something going on that needs professional help to deal with we are able to diagnose her but her doctor can could you maybe go to your baby next doctor appointment with your wife and bring up that you think she might need some help the first few months she should be getting screened for ppd ppa at baby appointments as well questionnaire she needs to fill out plus discussion with the doctor well beyond calling the police and getting psych hold on her she has to help herself it will take while it took me almost months pp but you need to be consistent when got into mood my husband would say do think this will be productive conversation we will come back to this later and physically leave the house it gets hard to get yourself worked up when there is no target did you go through ppd yourself if so can you recall your line of thinking when you were not yourself sounds like postpartum hormonal imbalance or exhaustion but would jump to conclusions one thing to consider are you sure there havent been any major shifts in your behavior towards her lot of people tend to be lazy when they have stay at home spouse expecting them to pick up the slack does she need help is she saying anything about wanting
